content: Most of the people that are into crypto spend lots of time, learning on their on in front of the computers , phone, laptop, tablets , anything that will provide them with information, but sometimes those are not enough.We could participate on events with topics are blockchains, web3, where also speakers who are well known in crypto, also founders, because not only you will learn a lot from them but also be inspire for what they have achieved over the years not only wealth but also knowledge.note: Be careful going to event who always ask for fee's people who are just using crypto to earn from fee's to enter their event where you learn nothing, this were organized by unknown people, pretending to know bitcoin etc.As much as possible spend less, some events only need registrations, to confirm that you can attend, attend only where you are interested so that you will have time, and do your own research, hope this helps are fellow member to know events coming on their area.Here is a link where you can see upcoming events in the future, please share if you have other links of crypto events thank you:https://bravenewcoin.com/eventshttps://cryptoevents.global/

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: There are some  thread which have been raised in the past concerning this op, Is going to a the bitcoin conference worth it?Going to Bitcoin eventsWhile Going to such events, can be very informative or educative, because you would meet alot of people who are like minded and probably share new ideas there are still some reason why alot of person would decide not to go 1. Some of these events are hosted by creators of shit coins, they have nothing to impact on you just trying to sell their coins.2. It puts a lot of peoples identity at risk exposing them to the public. Possibly to scammers, thief, kidnappers and lots more.3.In countries where cryptocurrency are banned it isn't adviced to join such gathering as governments officials will use this as a means to target such person.4.attending such events might be expensive and such people don't bother going but can decide to watch a video of it on tv or Livestream.I haven't been to such events before, and I don't think I will be attending any soon, but it isn't bad, as one would meet experts, learn new things and even meet new people from different parts of the world.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Unless I won't gain anything from promoting a business or networking with people, I'd rather pass. If I'd gain the same information/knowledge from watching a conference live and watching a replay on YouTube, it's not worth it — not money-wise, but privacy and security-wise.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: tech30338 on September 19, 2023, 04:02:35 AMMost of the people that are into crypto spend lots of time, learning on their on in front of the computers , phone, laptop, tablets , anything that will provide them with information, but sometimes those are not enough.It actually is enough. Learning for months in front of your computer and asking questions daily from more knowledgeable members is a much better way to learn than attending an event for a couple of hours hosted by multiple people.YouTube videos can replace the feeling of being a an event and has the advantage that you can choose what to learn at a giving point in time and can build on your knowledge gained.Crypto events are rarely centered on Bitcoin and exposes one to several shitcoins looking to build some publicity and reach a wider audience. comments.author: Ever-young
comments.body: I will prefer learning from my home, using my computer, and watching some tv presentation and any form of E-learning that can aid to my knowledge, it’s going to somewhere to learn from other authors is not something that everyone finds interesting, as time and other factors are also part of the reason most people preferred going digital, when you look at the time, and other expenses required to just go their you will have to discourage your self from learning.one thing that make most people lack knowledge about something today is because they don’t have the right source to get it, and how that things have been made all digital you still want someone to go and be squeezing their self in one hall all in the name of seminars, unless their are some special things which one will gain when they are available on the event center if not their is no point of going, even if they are our favorite person when it comes to motivation, you can still watch through their show online and drop your question in the comment section and things will be answered even more than it could be on the open seminar.

comments.author: Coyster
comments.body: I have never attended any of such events and i don't think i would even be interested in attending one. Mind you that you don't learn about Bitcoin in a Bitcoin conference that just lasts a few hours, and whatever thing that would be said there can easily be found online. As a matter of fact most people who attend these conferences already have enough knowledge of Bitcoin, they only attend for networking purposes.Not to talk about the risks involved in attending such events, and the disappointment of finding out that the conference wasn't actually about Bitcoin, but for one altcoin or the other. Learn over the internet, join Bitcoin forums like Bitcointalk; if you do these you might never see the need for these events.

comments.author: CryptopreneurBrainboss
comments.body: Quote from: tech30338 on September 19, 2023, 04:02:35 AMMost of the people that are into crypto spend lots of time, learning on their on in front of the computers , phone, laptop, tablets , anything that will provide them with information, but sometimes those are not enough.You didn't give a reason to why you said this isn't enough, learning on your own could be the best methods for you as to been around people, socializing could also be a distraction. Atleast when you learn alone you won't get disturbed about the next bitcoin (altcoins) as if they pop up as ads you could easily skip it. Most of the big names we have in the industry didn't attend those seminars or event that they're now hosting yearly as a means to generate revenue for their business and give publicity to the next scam (wanna be Bitcoin) that they're working on. Don't get me wrong as some of those bitcoin or cryptocurency related events are fun to attend and also educational but you shouldn't think your understating of Bitcoin depends on those events.Quote from: tech30338 on September 19, 2023, 04:02:35 AMWe could participate on events with topics are blockchains, web3, where also speakers who are well known in crypto, also founders, because not only you will learn a lot from them but also be inspire for what they have achieved over the years not only wealth but also knowledge.If you need inspiration then read about the core Bitcoin developers that have helped in bringing Bitcoin to where it is today, Satoshi didn't attend events even though back then Bitcoin wasn't popular to have a fan base but still he won't do it now that Bitcoin has become very popular. There isn't anything that's been taught or learnt on their event that you can learn at the comfort of your home. This events aren't the best suggestions to give because they're target of scammers, hackers and kidnappers that watch people that attend the event to make them their target (victim) to extort money from them.

They talked about some benefits of getting into crypto and then majorly discussed about their life and their success and afterwards sponsors took over the stage and started coming out one after the other to advertise their products/services to those that were present there. Although some were very educative while others were a waste of time but all the same I still don’t think it’s mandatory for newbies to go to crypto event if they wish to strive but if they have someone that they look up to and he’s hosting an event then they can go and learn from them but as for attending an event just because it’s crypto based I don’t support that, that’s just for me tho.
